Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If anybody has tips/tricks for debugging a potentially dead Innosilicon A9 hashboard, I would love to hear them. A buddy is asking me for help, the board is marked as "Alive" but shows 0's for everything else. The other 2 hashboards are fine

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright do you remember the max possible AC supply off the top of your head? I am searching for it but not finding it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @dukeleto there is a new mechanism for larger ac_supply numbers

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it will mine it over 10 blocks instead of a single block if it's larger than 2B I think

Author: Alright#0419
Content: don't know the exact details on it, but can get them if you need

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: max is 90 billion, in that case the first 90 blocks will get 1 billion

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if 10 or less, all at once

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the restriction is not more than 10 billion in any single transaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: due to some very deeply hardcoded limits

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: thanks, that is the detailed answer I needed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some people are asking me if they can do a 20B supply on an AC and I knew that was close to edge cases

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they can, with the caveat that no tx can be for more than 10 billion

Author: Varshini#4460
Content:
I got these error. What does it mean 

```
../wallet/db.h:37:14: fatal error: ../depends/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/include/db_cxx.h: No such file or directory
     #include "../depends/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/include/db_cxx.h"
              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.


```

Author: cipi#4502
Content: you need to install the package `libdb++-dev`, which contains the file that is missing

Author: Varshini#4460
Content: @cipi  can you help me with the command

Author: cipi#4502
Content: in Debian/Ubuntu it is `sudo apt-get install libdb++-dev`
